adjective.description: Relating to or affecting the human spirit or soul as opposed to material or physical things.
examples: I'm responsible for his spiritual welfare

adjective.description: Relating to religion or religious belief.

noun.description: A religious song of a kind associated with black Christians of the southern US, and thought to derive from the combination of European hymns and African musical elements by black slaves.

phrases: I had always thought of Italy as my spiritual home
The name was coined by pioneer Lach and, with the Side Walk Café becoming their spiritual home, anti-folk was born.
Now they are back at their spiritual home, a redeveloped Valley, solvent, competitive and stable.
Only once under Vogts, when Denmark won by a single goal in August, have his players been subjected to the pressure of playing at their spiritual home.
On Friday, Hearts chairman George Foulkes challenged McGrail and Deans to come up with a proposal which would keep the club at their spiritual home.
origin: Middle English: from Old French spirituel, from Latin spiritualis, from spiritus (see spirit).
